Close walking distance to Disney District (where you can take the monorail to Dosney or ealk through to access Californai Adventure park). Close to CVS, Dennys, a great Italian restaurant called Maria's super close. The corner store is closer but recommended taking a bit more of a walk or drive to CVS a few blocks away. There is AC in all the rooms. We stayed for a week and were able to get an adventure room for our older daughter and her friend. Super safe, lot of free parking. Highly recommend staying here, best value in the area.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at Alamo Inn & Suites.   It's fairly old compared to the more modern motels/hotels but it's kept very clean at all times. We are not picky, we just want a clean place to lay our heads at night.  If you prefer value, this is the place to stay.  The beds are a little bit on the hard side but we slept fine.  No daily in room service, but not many places are offering that right now anyhow.  I prefer the value over my bed being made each day.  Several good nearby restaurants.  The walk to Disney is about 20 minutes and it's an enjoyable walk.  You feel like you're on the resort property the entire way.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Service--ownership cutting corners to save themselves money and negatively affecting guests and staff
Summary: I absolutely love everything about this hotel except for one thing. Great location for a great price. However, since reopening after the COVID-19 pandemic, ownership has used it as an excuse to cut down room cleaning to once every three days. Of course, in the grand scheme of things this isn't a huge deal--but one of the perks of staying in a hotel is the daily service--and worse yet cutting down cleaning to 1/3 of what it should be is affecting the cleaning staff's hours and income. The rates are the same as they were when cleaning was daily--now guests are paying the same and the staff is getting 1/3 of the hours they previously had--all so the owners can pocket the extra cash by using the pandemic as a non-sensical excuse. There is no reason not to have full service and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback!  We are very happy to speak into some of your concerns.  What you have shared may describe many properties in the hospitality industry.  However, as a business, we feel strongly that our decisions have been driven by genuine care for our staff and guests, even if this meant that our owners would pocket less.  For instance, our ownership provided work for our employees through the pandemic even though many hotels laid off the majority of their staff by the Summer of 2020.  ~80% of our 2019 team are still on staff with us.  Regarding stayover cleaning protocols, the schedule was developed in collaboration with our frontline housekeepers.  We have nearly the same number of employees as we did in 2019 (the busiest year in Anaheim), but our employees have requested more time off for their families, reflecting a different priority in work-life balance following the pandemic, which we are doing our best to honor.  This naturally limits our capacity for stayover cleaning.  Please note however, that we welcome guests to request additional cleanings during the check-in process, and we do our best to schedule these in.  For your peace of mind, we have consistently provided full-time hours to the majority of our staff that want a full-time schedule.  While we may be a simple "no-frills" property, we take pride in how we operate, and we wanted to gently push-back on some of your assumptions (:

Summary: Nice hotel and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Love the free parking too! The bathroom just smelled a bit bad and we had to leave the window open for the majority of our stay to air it out. The walls are also a bit thin and we could literally hear guests using the restrooms. The walk to the parks were about 20-25 minutes and after a long day, it was a bit tedious for our kids. The shortcut from Grand California is no longer open since resort guests are only allowed to go through it. The monorail was also unfortunately down which didn't help. One suggestion would be to add a shuttle service that guests can use.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback with us!

Summary Heading: Clean , convenient location , even parrots in the trees😀
Summary: Clean and large rooms. Nice large window. There was a flock of at least 15 green/red parrots in the trees one evening. Walking distance to Disney and restaurants real close.  Bed sheet/ blanket not the heaviest , but does the job.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback!

Summary: We had a wonderful stay here and will definitely book again. If you're looking for a glamorous hotel, this isn't for you. But, if it is a place close to Disneyland, with free parking and very comfortable beds then this is your place! The bathroom is basic, but very clean and kept up. The shower head is not at all restricted so if you're like me and prefer to be drenched and not misted, then look no further. As mentioned by many other reviewers, the windows have shutters instead of curtains so a little light comes through but no enough to keep me from sleeping like a baby. Room also had a mini fridge, microwave and small coffee maker. Overall a good place for resting after each day of roaming Disneyland. Staff was very friendly as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share about your stay!

Summary: The only problem we encountered was with the wifi. We were able to connect the first night, but after that we couldn't get it to connect which was a big problem since someone in our party needed to submit an assignment for a class. Ì called the front desk about it but was told it was working no other help offered.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with our team.  We apologize that we did not offer the support you needed, and we look forward to doing better next time!

Summary: Nice hotel all within steps of Disneyland and restaurants.  Nice size room that accommodated four adults along with their eights suitcases after a seven day cruise.  Lots of room, comfortable beds, clean linens.
Manager Response: We are happy you were able to find some space to rest after your cruise - thank you for your feedback!

Summary: I loved how ever was close by for our Disney trip. Didn’t take the car at all. The front desk was helpful and very polite and the hotel itself was super clean and had everything we needed from a fridge to a microwave. Excellent hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your generous words and are happy that your stay was perfect!

Summary: Perfect location for walking to the park. Very fast and accurate check in and the staff was helpful with questions I had about directions. We slept so well in our bed and loved that we could hear the fireworks from the room. Parking was awesome as well and we were close to everything we needed in and out of the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous feedback - we are delighted to hear that you had an excellent stay!

Summary Heading: Great Stay Close to Downtown Disney
Summary: I have stayed here a handful of times and never have been disappointed. The staff is very friendly and helpful. This place is a hidden gem and has become our favorite hotel close to Disney! Thank you Alamo Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words - we are honored that you have already stayed with us several times, and we look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim on your next trip!

Summary: The Alamo Inn & Suites was perfect. My boyfriend and I had a little weekend getaway and our stay here was more than we could ask for. It was affordable and the room was just great. It has the basics and was pretty! We really enjoyed our stay here. 10/10 We will definitely be coming back here!
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind words and look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim!

Summary: Good stay, near Disneyland! No complications, front desk is friendly, got to you fast and check in took less then 10 Mins. The AC would be on and off and night but other than that no complaints what’s so ever , thank you.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay with us!

Summary: The motel is conveniently located on the Disney bus shuttle line... It is very clean and comfortable with modern furnishings. We enjoyed the family suite the extra bedroom came in handy for me to pass out early and the kids could stay up on their devices. My only complaint is that that extra little bedroom really needs a mirror in it so that the whole family can get ready at once.we fought over the mirror alot LoL the staff was very friendly to us even after my kids locked themselves out of the room TWICE in one day... OH AND DID I MENTION DENNY'S IS PRACTICALLY RIGHT NEXT DOOR
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing about your stay - we appreciate your feedback!

Summary: It would have been a 9 if we would have had room service and clean towels on Sunday.   We were able to sleep well and it was at a close distance to Disneyland. There are nearby places to have a quick breakfast or diner after a day of activities.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and look forward to improving our guest experience!

Summary Heading: Good quality very close to the park for good price
Summary: I stayed in the Alamo Inn in 1996 and the upgrades over the years are a nice improvement.  I've stayed in more expensive hotels that weren't as clean. I didn't spot a single cobweb or water stain like I have at other places. I needed a place close to Disneyland but did not want to pay for Disneyland hotel prices. It is also a quick walk to the convention center. I was originally going to the Star Wars Celebration in 2020 but Covid postponed it and the rescheduled dates didn't work so it was singularly a Disneyland trip.  It only took 10 minutes to walk to Downtown Disney and another 5 minutes to the front gates of the park.  I was able to check-in early to my twin double room (#230) with no problem. I didn't use the cleaning maid service during my stay. They'll come if you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay in detail.  We are glad to have you back after 25 years and look forward to welcoming you back much sooner next time (:

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Short walk to the monorail in Downtown Disney.  The room was clean, and roomy.  Fun place, close to Coco’s and an easy walkto the parks.  Traffic noise was what we expected on Katella.  I would stay there again.
Manager Response: We are glad you had a great stay and would be happy to welcome you back!

Summary: We have stayed at Alamo Inn numerous times. As always, our stay was pleasant and convenient. The location is within walking distance of Disneyland. Our room was comfortable and the shower had plenty of hot water. We would stay there again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind words and look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Great location, comfy beds, great staff
Summary: My mom and I are key holders at Disneyland, so we visit quite frequently. Since we aren’t local, we always get hotels close to the park. The Alamo is our favorite place to stay. The staff is helpful and accommodating, the rooms are always clean and comfy. Almost every inch of this beautiful hotel is covered in the most gorgeous plants. Kudos to the gardener! This hotel is a quick walk to down town Disney, and an ever quicker Uber ride. Me and my mom will continue staying at the Alamo for years to come!
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous words.  It brings our team a big smile to know that you appreciate our greenery (:  We look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: Very Friendly and perfect location for Disneyland trips. It is a Quiet & Safe location for the family. Disneyland is within walking distance and even just a Block away for quick meal at Dennys to start your day.
Manager Response: We are happy that you enjoyed a weekend getaway with us!

Summary: Great place to stay if you just need somewhere to sleep after a long day at Disney. Our only complaint is the noise level from other guests. We would stay again, but opt for somewhere else with children so that they can sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback with us!

Summary: Usually I stay along the front on Harbour Blvd and enter Disney from the transport centre but I found all the hotels there overpriced this time so thought I would try out Alamo Inn on Katella Ave which was significantly cheaper.  Check in was quick and easy and the room was a good size. There was a mini fridge and microwave, two beds and bedside table, dining sized table and side table and an arm chair. There was also a lovely outdoor area with a table and chairs where we ate meals.  There were really interesting louvre type doors and windows along the front which could be completely opened for heaps of light.  The room was only cleaned every few days since covid but was done very nicely then.   I would have liked more hooks in the bathroom. There was only one very small towel
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share about your stay in detail.  We are glad you gave our property a chance on your recent stay, and we would love the opportunity to welcome you back in the future!

Summary Heading: I’ve been staying at this hotel for long time now
Summary: This is the best hotel for me and my budget . It’s close to Disneyland, about a 15 min walk that takes you in front if Paradise Pier Hotel if you want to eat or shop in there & the same for the California Grand hotel across the street. And /or  goes straight through Downtown Disney toward the parks. I appreciated the hotel allowing us to check in early since we had arrived by uber. I also liked that we communicated through text when i needed extra towels and picked them up on our way back from the park. In this room the tv was placed above the microwave which sat on top of the fridge that was right by the hangers. We laughed at that but like i said we weren’t there for the amenities. I’m positive if i had a problem they would have fixed it right away. This will continue to be
Manager Response: We are honored that you've chosen us to be your go-to hotel and we look forward to providing great future stays!

Summary: People above were stomping back and all morning and night but not hotels fault . Bed was not the most comfortable but was able to get rest on last night after switching rooms. Overall stay was great.!
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and look forward to having you back!

Summary: This was my second stay here within 3 months and both stays were great. The hotel is very clean and quiet and the staff are friendly and helpful. Parking is free which is hard to find in the area and we had no issues with finding a parking spot, although both stays were during slower times so I’m not sure how it is during peak Disneyland times. We did find our mattresses to be rather springy and uncomfortable on this stay, but as luck would have it they got a new shipment of mattresses in during our stay and replaced ours for our last night and they were AWESOME!! Hopefully all the rooms will have these same mattresses now. I only wish they had a real coffee maker and decent coffee available in the office area. The rooms do have mini coffee makers and powdered creamer, but it
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous words.  We appreciate your thorough feedback and look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a quick trip to Disney!
Summary: I have stayed here before, and I will be staying here again in February! I like the proximity it is to Disneyland, and the fact that I can walk to the parks is a major plus. The staff are friendly & accommodating, and I feel very safe at this site, which is important to me because I often travel here on my own!
Manager Response: Cleanliness and safety are our top priorities, and we are honored that you have chosen to stay with us on multiple occasions.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary Heading: Where did all the dressers go.
Summary: Walked into the room and looked for a place to put our clothes.  Went to the office about it and they stated none of their rooms have dressers and the only place is in the closet(open, no doors).  Never hung my underwear or socks before.  Must be a new thing.  😉
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for..
Summary: The room was clean & safe. It clearly needed maintenance. Grimey bathroom tiles, missing paint and deep gouges in the drywall. Dust behind the TV unit. But the linens were clean and beds bug free.  The service was terrible. We had to beg to get our room cleaned the 2nd night of our trip. I understand Covid but I'm not getting a discount for the reduced service. The sheets were too small for the triple sheeted bed and they came off, leaving the bed a mess. I was not about to sleep directly on a hotel mattress pad. I work in the hotel industry, you do not want to know how (in) frequently those things are washed!   Things to note: *They charge $20 per room card if you don't return it!; Your key does get you a small discount at the Denny's right next door. This Denny's is cheaper
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay in detail.  We appreciate your honest feedback and look forward to building on our guest experience!

Summary: Great location, 10-15 minute walk to Disney.  Older hotel but nicely renovated.  Large room, 3 queen size beds.  The only “issue” with the room was that the phone didn’t work when I tried to call the front desk.  Very minor problem. Staff was friendly at check-in.  Denny’s next door which gives a discount to hotel guests so great place to have breakfast before hitting the parks.   Was the first time we stayed, but would definitely go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay.  We look forward to your next trip out!

Summary: Very basic hotel.  If you are staying here, you are going to Disney, so you won't spend much time in the room.  It is about a 1.5 mile walk to Downtown (straight up Disneyland Drive)  Nothing fancy, clean, simple, decent bed to sleep in.  There was a Marri's Pizza within walking distance if you get back to the room before Marri's closes.  If you are going to spend your day at Disney, this is an alright choice for the basics.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback with our team and guests!

Summary: It was a very nice and clean hotel, the staff were very accommodating. It is somewhere between a 10-15 minute walk from there to Disneyland but goes by very quickly. We would definitely stay there again as the room was very spacious and was very clean. We had a great time on our trip and would recommend this place to stay as it is fairly priced and close to Disney
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and well stocked. The building was old but nicely redone. Very close to Disneyland. 5min walk. My only complaint is it is a wood building and therefore could hear the people above us walking around or dropping something. Also the bathroom was quite small. Overall I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay - we appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: This hotel is ran by the Covid paranoid!! -office is barricaded and closed - no coffee or breakfast -too lazy too clean rooms, under guise of COVID paranoia -no housecleaning due to Covid laziness -laundry accumulates in room due to Covid laziness -have to ask for towels at office daily   Room was just adequately clean, mattresses where stiff and uncomfortable.  Parking was horrible!! Spaces area tiny, few walkways to stairs so your constantly cutting through bushes and getting scraped up.  Consider staying elsewhere!!
Manager Response: We are sorry that you feel this way about our property.  Please note that we have carefully developed our safety protocols according to recommendations from the CDC, city of Anaheim, and California Hotel and Lodging Association, which have frequently evolved over the past year.  Additionally, we have considered direct feedback from our staff in refining these protocols, as frontline employees in Anaheim were heavily impacted by Covid-19.  While this may be taken as paranoia and laziness, we ultimately want to be a property that prioritizes the safety of our guests and staff.  To provide perspective on a few items mentioned, we did not serve breakfast even prior to the pandemic, we have placed individual coffee makers in each room, and we are expecting our 3rd small shipment (for 2021) of new Serta mattresses in November.  We understand that there is much room for improvement, but we want our guests to know that we are genuinely doing our best in this challenging season (i.e. global and domestic friction, supply chain issues, constantly evolving restrictions).  Finally, in collaboration with our frontline housekeepers, we are in the process of gearing up for stay-over cleaning, and we look forward to providing this service for our guests in the near future!

Summary: It was a nice stay, however make sure you are aware of the Bus schedules around Disneyland.  evening was difficult as we were not aware of what bus to take back and thank goodness one of the local gave us info.  But we ended having to walk over a mile to get back to the hotel.  both of us had canes.  phone died and try to get assistance from a security guard at the Anaheim Convention Center after midnight, with no assistance at all.  we yelled and tried to flag him/her down as she was on a wheeled vehicle.  anyway we got back to hotel crossing street and taking # 50 bus ....
Manager Response: We are sorry for the trouble you experienced getting back to the property!  Thank you for taking time to share your feedback with our guests and team.

Summary Heading: Great customer service and clean comfy room
Summary: We booked lady minute overnight when trains to oceanside non operational for track work and we're so happy with our choice. Room was comfortable and has very nice bed. Microwave and mini fridge. We had walked there through downtown Disney which is a bit of a hike after a long day at Disneyland so we took the city bus the next morning. Woman at reception was so helpful showing us where bus stop is and telling us which bus to catch to drop us right at Disney gate. Will stay there again for sure. Thanks Alamo for making our change in plans work out even better than expected.  Modest hotel but great price and features.
Manager Response: We are sorry for the disruption in your plans due to transportation issues, but are happy that you discovered us.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: We always enjoy our stays at the Alamo Inn & Suites! The rooms are clean and the staff is very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. From check in, to check out, they met every need and exceeded every expectation. Can’t wait to stay again on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share such kind feedback.  We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip!

Summary: An older hotel but it was a very clean, quaint and  wonderful place!  Front desk was always very helpful and friendly. We were concerned about our walk to Disney but it was a beautiful walk (about 10 minutes) through Downtown Disney and into the parks.  The price was great and we will definitely stay here when we revisit the area.
Manager Response: We are happy you enjoyed your stay and looking forward to welcoming you back when you revisit the area!

Summary: The front desk was very accommodating, we arrived a hour early and the room was ready and they did not charge us for early check in fee. It was good for short trip for us. The area around was well light and kept up very. Handicap Parking was great right in front of our room.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay.  We wish you and your family well during this time.

Summary: Clean, comfortable and friendly staff.  Coffee maker in the room. Beds are comfortable. There is an elevator. Quiet. Across the street from the park. Coco's on the corner for breakfast. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay.  In such a challenging era for the hospitality industry, we are grateful for your kind recommendation!

Summary: The location was within walking distance to Disneyland and Downtown Disney. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. We were pleased with our room. It had everything we needed to be comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was excellent. Free parking was provided and we were able to park directly in front of our room. The price of the room was very reasonable. We would definitely consider staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay.  We are thankful for your kind feedback and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Alamo was great for us! We have 3 grown kids and needed 3 full size beds, but didn’t want two rooms. The rooms were clean, recently remodeled, had a cute little patio for each room, and plenty of space. The location was GREAT (east a block, up to paradise pier hotel, west around the hotel and then north to downtown Disney)- took about 10-15 min. Not fancy, no thrills, but a very good, clean, quiet stay!
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed a good, clean, and quiet stay (:

Summary Heading: Great for a weekend stay near Disney!
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend trip to Disneyland. The outside of the hotel is well maintained and we loved the European exteriors. It was a close walk to the parks and the room was clean and the bed was comfy. My husband has no trouble sleeping places, but I had some issues when neighbors would run the shower/sink since we were on the second floor. This may just be because of the particular room we were in, but once I was asleep it was fine. The only odd thing was the lack of bedside table lamps, other than that, our stay was great! We didn't deal with parking since we didn't have a vehicle, so I can't speak to that. The location and price were perfect for our needs.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and are happy that you enjoyed your weekend stay across from the parks!

Summary: Clean, comfortable, and a nice walk in the morning!  I have been going to Alamo Inn & Suites for many years now for every Disney stay.  They are so friendly and the rooms are very nice.  Price is of the best given it's A+ location, a 15 minute walk and your at Downtown Disney... or the Front Gate if really want!
Manager Response: We appreciate your generous feedback and are honored that you've chosen to stay with us over the years.  We look forward to do right by you by providing great future stays!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, and close to Disney
Summary: The room we had at Alamo Inn was nice and clean. The mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker were all in working order and came in very handy for our family of four. We had two queen beds that were comfortable and clean. We all slept well especially after walking all day at Disneyland. The walk to and from Downtown Disney took about 15 mins with a toddler in a stroller. It was a safe walk each time. The only thing to look out for is cars making right and left turns at Katella Ave. Most drivers slow down and stop, but there was the occasional person who couldn't spare the extra 5 seconds for pedestrians to cross. The staff was friendly, efficient, and helpful at check in. Thank you Alamo Inn and Suites!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share such kind feedback as well as the safety pointers!

Summary: Very friendly staff and very comfortable and spacious rooms. Great beds/pillows and ample linen provided. WiFi, TV, microwave and a fridge was provided at no extra cost. A small pool is there and it is clean as a whistle. Ample free parking.  One point of improvement to suggest is to provide separate bins for cans, bottles and plastic/paper waste, which will be appreciated by most visitors who are now concerned about waste recycling. In the interim, the staff seems to sort out these items when cleaning, which is commendable.  Great adventure. Keep up the good work.
Manager Response: Your words are an encouragement for us to continue fine-tuning our product!  We appreciate your point of improvement and will definitely consider how this might be incorporated formally into our system as we do want to care for our environment.

Summary Heading: This place, Alamo Inn and Suites is a great stay, location to Disney is awsome. Save the Disney parking fees.
Summary: We stayed in one of the suites. It was very comfortable. The shutter style windows was a great feature. We will file this place away for another future Disney visit. The staff was very accommodating, willing to get items we needed, like a clothing iron and board.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed a great stay and look forward to having you with us again!

Summary Heading: Great stay - easy walk to Disney
Summary: I had a great stay at the Alamo Inn. Parking was free and plentiful and the room was very clean with hardwood floors, microwave, and mini-fridge. Most importantly - it was an easy walk to Disney - go down Disneyland Drive and cut through Downtown Disney (don't walk down Katella to Harbor). After a park day - cut through Downtown Disney /  Grand Californian for a "short-cut". I found the best reception for the 7am ROTR / WS boarding groups to be in the Alamo parking lot instead of inside the room. Only negative point is that the walls / door are very thin - you can hear everything from the room above / neighbor rooms / parking lot. It is mostly very quiet otherwise.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you had a great stay and appreciate your feedback and tips!

Summary: Very good hotel.  GREAT location for the Disneyland crowd !  Only about a 15 minute walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland !!  The only "gliche" was you could hear the guests on the second floor every footstep ??!!  Just a minor issue though !!
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind feedback!

Summary Heading: The Alamo Inn & Suites Offers No Frills But A Great Location
Summary: Recently we had a coverage opportunity arise which would involve a fast over and back the next day trip to Southern California. The recent re-opening of the state combined with a long weekend for some, Father’s Day weekend, Theme Parks opening to out-of-state guests, A Major Golf event, and High School Graduations caused a severe demand for rooms.  From San Diego to Buena Park and smaller cities in-between; rooms were going for 3x-5x what the usual rates were and even during major events you can usually find a good deal if you are willing to stay about 30 minutes away from your destination.  After a frustrating search with multiple search options we have used in the past; we were able to find an acceptable rate at the Alamo Inn and Suites in Anaheim.  Upon arrival, we were able
Manager Response: We appreciate that you have taken the time to provide such thorough details regarding your recent stay with us!  As we have not opened up our lobby to serve coffee as usual, we have been placing individual coffee makers in each room.  By the end of this week, most rooms should have their own basic coffee maker (:

Summary: We love this gem of a hotel! Clean, quiet and friendly staff! A great place for anyone! Parking is plentiful, rooms are spacious and super clean. About a 15 minute walk to Disneyland and has plenty of restaurants and convinces nearby! Looking forward to our next visit with them!
Manager Response: Thank you for you kind review.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: A good nights rest from Mickey
Summary: Quiet relaxed motel within an easy walk to downtown Disney. Very Covid clean and careful without being overly fussy.   Staff are friendly and fast - and easy walk to Brewberry Coffee. AC unit a bit noisy - but efficient and somewhat as expected at this price point.
Manager Response: We appreciate your detailed feedback!

Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel for a family vacation for two nights. You are required to deposit a "REFUNDABLE" $75.00 prior to check in. Upon check out I left the room nice and clean. I did not check in early nor did I check out late.  I did NOT get my REFUNDABLE DEPOSIT.  Be cautious they will STEAL YOUR DEPOSIT.  If I knew about how this place operate and the dishonesty service I would of went elsewhere.  TO EVERYONE YOU HAVE BE WARNED OF THIS PLACE!
Manager Response: Hi John,  We have received multiple reviews from you regarding this issue at this point.  Although we have attempted to reach out to you in each instance, we have not received any response.  If there was a misunderstanding or delay in refund, we would certainly be happy to look into this for you.  While our team processes the deposit refunds fairly quickly (within 1-2 business days), please note that it will usually take an additional 5-10 business days for a card company to complete their end of the transaction.  In situations where there have been clear damages or evidence of smoking, the deposit will not be refunded.  Kind regards,

Summary: All the personnel at this establishment were polite, friendly and helpful. We requested a coffee maker, iron and the immediately provided. Even with the Pandemia restrictions they were always made sure our room had all necessities .
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous words.  We have been working diligently to improve our customer service, even during challenging times, so we are ecstatic to hear that our team was able to meet your requests!

Summary: We were so happy to be back at our happy place (Disney) this past weekend. We were very happy with the remodel the room with new paint and then wood accents. The walk from our room was much closer than the walk from the parking garage since the trams weren’t running. We were very happy!
Manager Response: We are so happy you were able to enjoy the parks from the convenience of our location!  We have been told before that it takes less time to walk from our property than the parking garages, and it sounds like your experience confirms this (:

Summary: Give me what I'll requested when I called ahead ... the weekend stay was great ,quiet, people are friendly and helpful. We use the pool with time slot. We always stay here and continue stay here for business and pleasure. Thank you
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback.  We are happy to hear that our team was able to accommodate your requests and that you had a great stay!

Summary: Really a delightful place to stay.  The room was clean and neat.  The WIFI and TV were great, easy parking in a quiet and safe neighborhood.  Management and staff were courteous and professional.  Disney was shut down during my stay, however, it is a good place to stay if you are visiting Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  While these have been challenging times due to the global pandemic, we place high value in taking care of our guests and staff!

Summary: Alamo Inn & Suites is the perfect location for a quick Disneyland trip. 10 min walk to Downtown Disney and parks. As a solo traveler I felt safe at the hotel. Room was comfortable and clean, the price was on point. Will definitely stay here again on a future Disneyland trip! Lauren Cavazos
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share such nice feedback!  We look forward to having you again!

Summary Heading: Thank you Alamo Inn taking good care of me. <3
Summary: Alamo Inn provides clean, remodeled rooms and most importantly #TopQualityService! Special thanks to all the Staff here. Hospitality is #TopNotch #period. Also use your room key to save $ at nearest #Dennys. I would use it to add to your tip, #TIPFORWARD!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us.  Please take care and stay safe!

Summary: We stayed at the Alamo just as Covid-19 was taking hold. Sadly, we had to cut our stay short, but in the three days we were there, it was excellent! Sure, it’s not the Candy Cane (which we love) but it was almost half the price at the time of booking. We paid $US109 per night (tax etc included) – and it has a fridge AND a microwave, whereas the CC only has a fridge.  Provided you’re happy to walk (and we are - and we had no car) it’s well located too. It’s a 20 minute walk to Disneyland (via Downtown Disney); 15 minutes to the west is ‘Food For Less’, a huge and very cheap supermarket, and there are fast food shops, restaurants, CVS, Walgreens etc 15 minutes east at Harbor/Katella. And there’s a Denny’s (15% discount for Alamo guests) and a mini-mart next door.  We are
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience!  We look forward to welcoming you back as traveling recovers.  Until then, take care and be safe!  Kind regards,  Front Desk Management

Summary: The motel is a very small motel.  It is clean but the rooms are very small and don't have much in them.  There is a small fridge (which made so much noise, we left if off) and a chair besides the bed.  The location is great to Downtown Disney but the only restaurant in the area that is open right now is Dennys.  There is no maid service and if you want to use the pool, you have to reserve time.  We were in the back and still could hear traffic on Katella.  Also, you can hear anyone talking loudly outside.  There are quite a few homeless people in the area and they are asking for money.
Manager Response: We appreciate you honest feedback!  Due to the current situation, we have minimized otherwise standard services as part of our Covid-19 Prevention Plan (i.e. housekeeping, pool use).  We are truly sorry and sad about this, but want to put in our best effort to keep our guests and employees safe through this time.  We would love if you give us another shot in the future, as restrictions lift, and since we do offer a variety of room types.   Kind regards,  Front Desk Management

Summary: I came here with my son for a quick trip to downtown disney. We had a great time. All the staff is very nice and the room was clean and comfortable. The property is pretty and well-maintained, with plenty of parking. Nice walk to downtown disney. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  We are so glad that you had a great trip with your son and look forward to having you with us again!

Summary: This place charges an extra $10 for each additional automobile associated with a single reservation. Meaning if you come in more than one car, only the first one is free. Michelle at the front desk told me," it's on the website." I didn't find where it states that.
Manager Response: Hi Terrance,  Thank you for taking time to share your honest feedback and we are sorry for the disappointing experience!  Our websites do indicate that we maintain strict limitations of one vehicle per reservation.  We do this to do our best to ensure complimentary parking for our registered guests.  Given the global impact of the pandemic, we've had much more vacancy in recent months, and we decided to implement the flat fee for a 2nd vehicle when space allows.  While we wanted to provide this flexibility for our guests, we also felt a basic fee would help us maintain traffic and uphold our safety standards.   We apologize for any misunderstanding and hope that you'll reconsider us in the future.  Kind regards,

Summary: We have stayed here twice in the past and its not been nice, but ok. Cheap. We were supposed to stay there 2 weeks ago, but then Disneyland closed and we were en route to california. They would not refund our money or work with us in any way. We were out the full price. I know you are trying to stay in business, but that was unacceptable behavior. I will never stay there again due to that and will not recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Hi Jane,   We are sorry for this experience.  Indeed, our management team has been flooded with cancellation requests and have diligently refunded the majority of our reservations without questions.  If you can please forward your reservation directly to alamoinnandsuites@gmail.com, we would be very happy to review your specific situation.   Kind regards,  Front Desk Management

Summary Heading: Great value and close to Disneyland
Summary: Perfect spot to stay - close to Disneyland!  Room was small but recently remodeled and was very clean.  Included a fridge and microwave.  Would have been nice to have a coffee pot too.  The beds and pillows were very comfy.  Excellent value for the price.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and it was a great 2 night stay. We arrived in the evening and check in was pleasant and efficient. Our room was not fancy, but clean and nicely renovated.  It's maybe an older hotel but we just needed a place to stay for a day at Disneyland. My daughter enjoyed the hottub and although it was too cold to use the pool, it looked nice. We felt safe and comfortable.  There is no breakfast included (or restaurant on site) but the room key had a discount for the Denny's next door across the street. There was a mini fridge in the room we could put our own drinks and light breakfast items in that we had picked up. The shuttle bus to Disneyland stops out front of the Denny's and I believe it was $4/person - exact change required.  The hotel included
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write such a detailed review.  We are especially glad to you enjoyed the hottub and noticed the pool, as we recently made some updates (:

Summary: this february was my fifth visit to Disneyland staying in this hotel. its always clean and the employees has always been nice and helpful. about good 15 minutes walk to the parks. Also a dennys on the side.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you've stayed with us so many times already!  Thank you for sharing your thoughts and we look forward to your next trip!

Summary Heading: Prime location, cheap, clean, room nicely remodeled, otherwise austere
Summary: For $100 a night this hotel is a good value. Just a ten minute walk to Downtown Disney. The rooms are clean, look newly remodeled, and are relatively quiet/well insulated. It is handy to have a fridge and microwave in the room. The pool is not heated, but the jacuzzi was hot. No coffee makers in the room, but there is freshly brewed coffee in the lobby in the morning. Strict policy of one car only that must be gone by 6 PM the next day. If you’re going to Disney past 6 PM, you may be able to find a parking spot early in the morning on the first street west of the hotel (S. Casa Vista Street). It’s the only street that doesn’t require a permit. All days are good, except Thursday (street sweeping). I got this tip at the Alamo reception desk. Friendly people.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time share your experience.  We appreciate the detailed review!

Summary: I love the fact that it sleeps 6 people, I don't have to get two rooms for me and family. The hotel  was clean and quiet. The staff were friendly. It was a very quick 15 min walk to downtown Disney so that was even better.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about your experience.  We are glad you enjoyed our family suite!

Summary: Alamo is a good place to stay if you want to visit Disneyland about 15 mins away, or are going to the Convention Center, it just a block away. The staff was very upbeat & helpful. Several places to eat near the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate your kind words!

Summary: For the price and the closeness to Disneyland it was very nice very clean and quiet. Had a cute little patio with a table and chairs. The room itself was very large with a wooden floor which I like. I would definitely stay here the next time I come to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous words.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness of the room and the walkable distance to downtown Disney. Having the refrigerator and the microwave in the room made packing snacks very easy. The only down side was the loudness of the location we were in. We were at the back of the hotel on the bottom floor. The back of the hotel is next to apartment buildings. You could hear everything, the cars starting for work in the morning, the toilet flushing upstairs, the children's feet running upstairs. The walls are not thick.. However we are still planning on going back to the Alamo, next month! Just hopefully on the top floor and not near the back :)
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest feedback.  We are glad that you will be returning and hope you will have a better stay!

Summary: Clean, and conveniently located walking distance to theme parks. Bed was comfortable. Wish there had been a coffee maker in room but a fridge and microwave were provided in room. There was coffee provided in lobby during certain hours
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your stay.  We appreciate your honest feedback!

Summary: This hotel was very walkable to Disneyland and near Coco's and Denny's for late-night or early morning dining. The king bed was comfortable and large and the recently renovated bathrooms were clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience - we are happy you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: We stayed 10 nights in a standard hotel room with our two children. The location is great for a Disney adventure with the walk only 15 mins to the gate of dinseyland.  The rooms are spacious and bathroom is adequate. It's a budget motel but very very clean, well located and had plenty of space to stretch out. We enjoyed the pool but found the laundry facilities being in the pool yard a little strange but then oddly convient. It's located around a few cafes and diner, the Italian restaurant down the street is also delightful! We found that the reception staff weren't as hospitable as we are accustomed to in Australia but feel we may have been a bit much with a total traveling party of 15. Thanks for having us Alamo we had a fabulous time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  We definitely want to grow in taking care of our guests so we will note your feedback!  Safe travels home!

Summary: Awesome service, friendly staff and close walking distance to Disneyland 😊.Were happy to check in our bags early and look after them till late on checkout day. It was handy the reception was open 24/7.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and convenience of location!

Summary: If you plan on going to Disney and want to stay off property - We highly recommend the Alamo Inn.  Walking distance from Disney Way and the Downtown Disney.  Affordable, clean and most of the rooms were newly remodeled.  We have been here - 4 times with our 5th coming soon - the staff have been with the site for a while and we've come to know them.  Always a smile and laugh to be had. Can't wait to see them again!
Manager Response: Thank you for such kind words.  We are glad you have come to know our team and look forward to having you again!  Happy New Year!

Summary: The hotel has been upgraded, it looks new and it’s very comfortable, clean & family friendly. Front desk is always available, attention is great and staff helps anytime you need something. I have stayed there twice a year for five years now and I’ll keep doing it.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience!  We appreciate your kind words and look forward to continuing our improvements.

Summary: We went on vacation with our two little's. We liked that the hotel was really close to Disneyland, dinning and shopping. The rooms were clean and the property seemed to be well taken care of. We will definitely be using this hotel for future trips!
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous words.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you again!

Summary: Room was clean and tidy good value for money. Very comfy beds. Bathroom had a reno and fitted out very well. Parking area location is convenient to room.Friendly staff. Would return again for my next stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback.  We are glad you had a positive stay and would love to have you again!

Summary: Easy to check in and out. Rooms were clean. Parking was easy. I have stayed here several times while taking the family to Disneyland. They have remodeled and the price is great. Several options for eating on the same side of the street. No complaints.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  We are glad you have enjoyed your stays and please let us know if you do have any complaints in the future!

Summary: A lovely place to stay .we stayed 3 nights in October. .walking distance to disney land. Could see california adventure from the front of the hotel.places to eat nearby as no restaurant on site we went out for breakfast. Dennys is nearby and you get 15% off as you are staying at the hotel. Ideal for a short day ofor maybe 1 or 2 nights as there is no wardrobe to hang your clothes so had to live out of the suitcase. There is also no tea/coffee making facility in the room but there is complimentary coffee in reception. Check in was a breeze .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable place. Very good value. Close to Disney parks by foot or ART bus.
Summary: This is the 2nd time we've stayed here. Our room was very clean with comfortable beds. Very good value! Close enough to walk to Disneyland, but there is also an ART bus stop next door . Runs every 20 minutes. We will stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: We are very glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The hotel was clean and kept very well. The staff was friendly and helpful. My clothes were not done washing by the time it was supposed to be closed and the manager kept it open to let me finish. The price is amazing for how close it is to Disneyland!I will definitely book here when I go back!  - Richard
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed Oct 21st - Oct 25th and we booked a double queen but we were given a suite for the same price. Not sure how that happened but no complaints on our side. Room was amazing! We stayed in room 221. Only complaint is I think I got bit by some bugs in the extra room that the suite comes with. Not 100% sure if this was from being out and about at Disneyland or from the room. However, our stay was amazing. Staff was friendly. The room was very clean. Our room came with a microwave and mini fridge. If you’re walking to the parks, you could try to wait for someone to open the gate at the Grand Californian and cut through there to Downtown Disney. However, going early in the morning there is hardly anyone coming out of the gate. What we did was walk all the way
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and park tips!  It does not happen often, but we do like providing an upgrade when our inventory management allows.  Our team maintains a consistent pest control and quality check routine, but we appreciate your feedback and will definitely look into the bug complaints.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: My best friend and I booked this hotel early in the year for a quick weekend birthday celebration to Disneyland. I didn’t realize I had double booked a room, and the lady at the front desk, Karina Hernandez, was so sweet and accommodating! She was so helpful and explained what happened, and even gave us an email address to inquire about a refund while making sure to let us know it wasn’t guaranteed. On our way up to the room a cleaning lady offered to help us get our bags to our room as well. We ended up getting a refund for the room after all, and I just wanted to commend the staff and especially Karina for her immaculate customer service. The entire staff was extremely helpful. Our guest experience here was A++ thanks to Karina and the rest of the wonderful staff on hand.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback.  We are happy to hear that our team was able to deliver a positive experience for you and your best friend!

Summary: First time staying at this property and will definitely book again. Staff is friendly and got us right in to our room early. Room was super clean, modern and perfect for our needs. Loved the pocket door on the restroom, made for it not feeling so cramped in there. Linens were high quality, lots of modern conveniences in the room. AC worked great, it was a bit warm outside. Just a short walk to Disneyland. So nice to park at the hotel and walk over for the day/evening. Lots of restaurants, convenience stores, etc. in walking distance for our needs as well. We paid a very reasonable price for this room, it totally exceeded our expectations. I would recommend this property to anyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback.  We appreciate your kind thoughts and are so glad that you enjoyed your stay!

Summary Heading: So Close to Disneyland! Great Rooms and Staff!
Summary: We have always stayed here when We visited Disneyland and have never been Disappointed! The Staff Are always Welcoming & So Helpful when You need Something. With Disneyland Drive right across the Street, just Leave your car Parked and Walk right over to Disneyland! The Remodeled Rooms Are Gorgeous-Bravo Alamo See You next year!
Manager Response: There is always much that we want to implement in order to improve our guests' experience, so we are encouraged by your kind feedback.  We look forward to having you again next year!

Summary: Clean and comfortable! We enjoyed our stay and saved money! Staff were polite and friendly. I would recommend this place to family members and friends. It would be a nice addition if they sold tickets for the ART shuttle to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience as well as your feedback!

Summary: Great price . Ideal for going to disneyland as you can park and walk to the park. We got our parking free enjoyed the disney for the day and checked in at midnight . Very clean and spacious. Next to restaurants that are open late which is awesome
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: We were wonderfully surprised by how nice this hotel was/is. Updated rooms. Great location. Hot water haha. Housekeeping was fantastic. The only downside was no roll away beds or whatever for babies or toddlers. We pushed two plush arm chairs together for a toddler bed and housekeeping was great at cleaning up the spilled Cheerios and messes we left. Pool and hot tub were clean and nice to come back to. Maybe 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland through downtown Disney.
Manager Response: We are happy your family was pleasantly surprised and thrilled you enjoyed the stay.  Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

Summary: This was our second time staying here.  Super cute hotel.  We requested the same room we had last time because it's like a mini apartment.  We couldn't get it, however we got the same type of room on the first floor.  We love how secluded that corner room feels. Surrounded by all the greenery and having that little patio area in the front is just too cute.  Not a lot noise from neighbors either.  The bed in this room was a lot harder than we expected but after 14 hours at Disneyland, we were so tired it didn't really bother us.   The only down side was we had 2 spiders in our room. I don't do spiders!  At check out we informed the front desk that the room should be sprayed for bugs.  The employees were so nice and apologized and even called me on our drive home to let me know
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to provide such a kind and thorough review.  Happy belated from our team here and we look forward to having you with us again!

Summary: I recently stayed at the Alamo Inn for my seven day trip to Disneyland from the East Coast. Pro’s:   I found the Alamo to be a very good choice. The rooms themselves were updated, modern, and impeccably clean.  It was a good value for the money and the location was right across the street from a huge parking lot that is by the Paradise pier Hotel and main security entrance to downtown Disney.    The staff was very friendly, there was a good choice of vending machines and access to ice and all very clean and stocked.   I’ve tried a number of off property hotels being the three that disney have unlike in Florida are in affordable and not any kind of value for what they charge. Con’s:   The towels in the room were like sandpaper, and that’s not exaggerating.  Actually uncomfortable
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest feedback!  Regarding the towels, we are actually in the process of researching potential upgrades and hope to provide that for our guests sooner than later.  We appreciate your time!

Summary Heading: The property and location worked out great for my visit
Summary: A 2 night stay was great. Free parking. Short walk to several places to eat. ART stop close by. And a great room rate for Anaheim/Disney. Wood laminate flooring, so a carpet doesnt turn your feet black, loved it. Everything clean, working. Room was large for a single king bed. Had a cute balcony with chairs, small table for hangin outside.It was just what I needed. I have to say, I was unsure from reading older reviews, about staying here. But it was a good price, so I gave it a shot. Glad I did. Front desk staff friendly. Plenty of parking on my stay. Has an elevator if you dont like  stairs.  The only things missing was the usual clock radio (for the time) and in-room coffee maker.I didnt look before booking, so my bad. But coffee is usually there in the front desk. Have to
Manager Response: Thank you for thoroughly sharing your experience.  We appreciate your feedback and look forward to building on your positive experience!

Summary Heading: Best Deal: Safe, Clean, and Great Staff
Summary: We booked the family suite for a staycation because a family friend was coming into town with her two kids. The suite was spacious, clean, and had everything we needed for our stay. The pool hours are great--open until 10pm and back open at 7am to get a swim in before checking out. Front desk staff was kind when we asked for towels and when asking for an extended checkout time. We will definitely be staying here in the future again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words.  We are ecstatic that your family had a great time and we would love to have you with us again!

Summary Heading: Very clean room and very nice people.
Summary: The room was nice, parking was on sight and ample.  There are no coffee pots in the rooms but there was  coffee available in the office.  The room did have a microwave and a refrigerator. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback with us.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: Good room right across from Disney but you have to go through down town Disney so still have like a 15 min walk to the parks only complaint if I had to pick one was parking but it's for Disneyland so what parking ain't a headache. Staff was friendly will visit again
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your experience.  We look forward to having you again!

Summary Heading: Good budget place to stay when visiting Disney
Summary: Not the best hotel, but pretty good budget hotel when visiting Disney. You can walk from the hotel to the main entrance of Disney in about 15 -20 minutes. We Ubered and the cost was minimal. If on a budget this is a good place to stay that way you have more money for the parks.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and are happy that we were able to meet your budget needs!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel from June 22 - 30.  We had a one bedroom suite at the back of the hotel.  The room was clean, beds were very comfortable.  Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping was also very helpful.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget.  Had absolutely no complaints.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  We appreciate your kind words and are happy you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: If you look for an hotel with fair prices near the Disneyland, than this is the right place. The hotel is so close that you can go to Disneyland and also to the Anaheim Convention Center on foot in a ten-minute walk. It's also very easy to find the hotel using public transportation, I was in the ARTIC (Anaheim transit Station) and it was necessary only to take the bus number 50 of OC Bus Line, in 10 minutes I was there. Look forward to come back again, the reception was also pretty good, the check in and check out were fast and all the rooms were good enough to spend the night, and there is also a pool, maybe next time I'll try it.
Manager Response: Thank you for spending time to provide such detailed and kind feedback for our property.  We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: I HIGHLY recommend this place!! I was skeptical at first, from some previous reviews, but the price was right, and they were able to accommodate 6 adults in one room (3 beds) with plenty of room for all of us. It’s very clean, very quiet and the staff is amazing!! We will return again in October! Thank you Alamo Inn for amazing accommodations!! See you in October!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest and kind feedback. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your next stay!

Summary Heading: Not sure why they received two stars because they were great
Summary: We enjoyed our stay. I am a native So.Cal and we were visiting Disneyland and on a budget. I was able to book the mini suite and it was perfect. The hotel looks like a French cottage (and yes, I have been to France). There was beautiful ivy and flowers all over the Inn. Each room had their own patio with a small table and two chairs. The Inn looked redone about 10 years ago or less. Our bathroom and room was comfortable. The staff was so accommodating and friendly. We were a 7 minute or less walk to Disneyland ( we used the not so known CA Adventure access which cut our walk time in half). Price was very comparable and we are a family of 5. Great stay. My only (first world) complaint was the toiletries. I'm pretty sure the same gel was in every bottle, the body wash, shampoo,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share so thoroughly about your stay!  We are glad you enjoyed an overall positive experience, and we do appreciate your feedback regarding the plumbing as well as provided toiletries - there is always much for us to improve on.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: The Alamo Inn is conveniently located just a few blocks from the Anaheim Convention Center when we attended the USA Judo Junior Olympics.  Plenty of parking allowed us to park at the Inn, walk to the venue, and forgo the $16 parking fee at the Convention Center. The room was spacious and clean, and came with a microwave oven and refrigerator. The bathroom appeared to have been recently remodeled.  Pool and jacuzzi were an additional plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback.  We are glad you appreciated your stay and look forward to having you again!

Summary: In the 30yrs we have been using this venue no significant change has happened apart from a paint job 15yrs ago, and a more recent replacement of the aged carpet with floating timber which showed signs of wear and jerry-rigged repairs. The beds however were surprisingly comfortable and comparatively new. Nevertheless there are no coffee  facilities, nor refrigerator in the rooms and WiFi reception is patchy and unreliable at best. At one time, it was economical for a family, however the price creep over the years is inconsistent with the quality delivered.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback.  We are sorry for your disappointment and definitely want to provide a better experience.  Please note that we do provide microwave/fridge combos in each room - if you are able to forward reservation details to alamoinnandsuites@gmail.com, we would definitely be happy to look into this for you.  We appreciate your thoughts and will share this with our team!

Summary: Nicely updated king room on the second floor, with a little sitting area outside on the "patio". Quiet location despite being near a main drag. Walking distance to Disneyland. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback.  We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you with us again!

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable hotel near Disneyland
Summary: We were looking for a cheap, comfortable hotel within walking distance of Disneyland and that’s exactly what we got. We arrived at 8am and got a parking pass for our car and then walked to Disney. It’s about a 20 minute walk from door to door but a lot of it is through Downtown Disney. After a long day, we arrived back at the hotel and checked in. Our room was very big and comfortable, I slept like a log! We were in the corner of the hotel so we couldn’t hear the noise from the road, apart from an occasion truck. The shower was nice and the room had everything we needed. I would definitely stay here again if I was coming back to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This hotel is in a great location if you are looking for a place to stay at Disneyland. It was a few minute drive or walk to the parks and we just needed a place to sleep when we weren't at the park. The hotel is medocre and is basic, but it's a great place to stay for cheap. The biggest downfall to this hotel is that the beds are stiff, almost like laying on a table with no give. But we didn't have a problem sleeping because we were so exhausted from the parks. The room seemed to be moderately updated though. We were confused because things were getting unplugged when the room was cleaned, not sure why. But if you are looking for a deal this place is it! There are restaurants and coffee places within walking distance as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience!

Summary: Pros- location was great about 10 to 15 minute walk to downtown Disney, rooms were spacious, parking was nice it was in its own secure parkade, right next door to a Denny's a liquor store and an awesome restaurant called Coco  Cons - once you enjoy the hot tub after a long day of driving and there were there cockroaches in it swimming, bathroom was quite outdated shower was pretty gross, staff wasn't overly the nicest.  Would definitely stay here again just for the location alone.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your feedback!

Summary Heading: 3 Rooms in a matter of 12 hours - Unapologetic Staff - Empty Promises
Summary: Booked this room for a night so that my boyfriend and I could spend the weekend at Disneyland. The location was the only positive detail when it came to this place.  We were assigned our first room which was tucked away in a pitch black corner.  After walking in, we saw that it hadn't even been touched by housekeeping (first red flag). We walked back to the lobby and was assigned a 2nd room without an apology or mention of the inconvenience. Our 2nd room was upstairs. Outdated with the sink right next to the bed. Fine whatever.  After spending the day at the park, we arrived back to our room to find it sweltering. In January. Absolutely no air circulation and you couldn't open a window. We turned on the 100 year old AC unit hoping for some relief. After about an hour of the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This place sucks, don’t stay here.
Summary: Let me start with, if there were a way to give this place a lower rating I totally would. Honestly, this was probably one of my worst hotel stays. For starters, one of the sheets on the bed was covered with stains, we told the staff and they did absolutely nothing about it. It was disgusting. Second, the cleaning of the room was so half assed and when staff were told they looked at me like I was crazy. We stayed in a family suite and when we came back from our day out only one bed was made. I brought this up to staff and they said it was policy that if there was “too many things” on the bed then they weren’t allowed to move it. I totally understand that, I’ve worked at hotels before, some high end ones some not so high end so I understand. BUT if you call “too many things” a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice room. Good price. Close to Disneyland.  For the TV that was in the room, I would have liked it better if there was a paper that had a list of all the channels the TV got, or some kind of TV Guide.  Also, it would have been better for me if the pillows on the bed were a little thicker. My pillow was a little flat for my liking (but that's just me).  Other than that, I would come back to this hotel the next time I come to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share about your experience.  We will discuss your feedback with our team!

Summary: Easy walking distance to the parks. I thought my room was pretty decent given the low cost. Nothing fancy, but fairly spacious and clean. I overall felt safe here. No problems with the staff. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience.  We look forward to your next stay!

Summary Heading: Horrible Staff that Steals and Lies
Summary: I will start off by saying that housekeeping was great, the room was clean and spacious, and I was very impressed with the room for the price we paid. Now on the the jerk that checked us in. He had a bad attitude and was rude. He upcharged us for the rollaway and charged double what Hotels.com said it would cost. He downgraded our room from two queen beds to two full beds but didn’t comp us for the inconvenience. He triple charged my credit card by changing for one night at a time times three when we only stayed two nights. When I asked management for a refund for the extra charges, they admitted he was wrong and said accounting would call me within 24 hours. The next day I received a call saying I was being partially refunded which isn’t good enough and the refund still hasn’t
Manager Response: Hi Britany,  We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this with you further.  There are instances where our front desk agents may make mistakes (i.e. overcharge, etc), but our routine is to void or refund any incorrect charges within 1-3 business days.  Please note that it does take additional time for the card company to complete the transaction.  If you could contact us at (714) 635-8070 and ask to speak with a front desk manager or if you are able to email us at alamoinnandsuites@gmail.com and provide your reservation #, we should be able to quickly resolve any errors on our part.    Once again, we are sorry for your negative experience and look forward to hearing back from you.

Summary Heading: Find a better place to stay!!
Summary: I don't like leaving a bad review, but I have to be honest so others know what to expect.  The positive I was able to find was the location to Disneyland.  It is about a mile away and you can walk there.  As soon as we got in the room to turn on the lights, one of them didn't work.  A lamp by the bed had a power cord that was cut.  Don't know if they are supposed to have those binder of hotel information / area info, but they didn't.  The first time I have stayed anywhere that didn't have it.  The refrigerator was missing the door on the freezer part, so the food and sodas I put in it was frozen and couldn't eat.  The TV didn't work.  I checked on the connection and everything was fine.  Making sure it wasn't the remote, the tv itself wouldn't do anything.  One of the pillow
